intro: Tripterygium wilfordii var. regelii, commonly known as Fan-leafed Thundergod, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red berries that contain toxic seeds. It is valued in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive properties. However, it is considered highly toxic and requires careful handling.
